result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shatoria L Cannon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shatoria L Cannon appeared by video.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Shatoria L Cannon.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Statements by defense as to defendant's missed zoom appearance. Defense requests another status conference date. Court will allow one more status date. Case adjourned for in-person status conference, Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shatoria L Cannon not in court.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo appeared by video for Shatoria L Cannon.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR.
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 15.
Calendar call scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shatoria L Cannon appeared by video.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo appeared by video for Shatoria L Cannon.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/24/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Shatoria L Cannon in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 15 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/22/22 @ 2:30p
